candidates.name: Melanie Kenrick
candidates.why_elect: I worked for over a decade as a senior mental health nurse and team leader. I am now an education charity trustee and kids' sports coach. I have the skills and experience to work effectively with the wide range of people within Kaipatiki.
candidates.why_stand: I was raised in Birkenhead, and am raising my family hear. I want to make sure what our community values is protected and enhanced. I want action on issues that could improve Kaipatiki, from the annoying lack of rubbish bins in parks and cracked paths to traffic issues.

candidates.name: Cindy Schmidt
candidates.why_elect: I work in the challenging area of health. I'm known to be efficient, effective and conscientious. This year I won a local hero award for establishing a health clinic for young people. This clinic is being modeled in mental health settings. I will bring an innovative approach to the community.
candidates.why_stand: For 19 years I have worked as a registered nurse, advocating for families and protecting communities is what I do. Protecting our unique environment is my priority. We live in an amazing place with great outdoor spaces so we must do all we can to protect our Kauri and waterways.

candidates.name: Andrew Shaw
candidates.why_elect: I bring a calm head and demeanor, a long-term view for the future and the region. I have an inclusive style of working and look forward to being an effective board member.
candidates.why_stand: I've always had an interest in planning for the future, and Intergenerational equity. Which I see as insuring my children's children have the same access to the natural environment, clean air, clean water, and safe neighborhoods as I did when I was growing up. Sounds like Local Board to me.

candidates.name: Anne-Elise Smithson
candidates.why_elect: Last election I promised greater protection of our natural environment. Kaipātiki is now leading the way for Auckland Council. I bring a head for scientific, evidence-based decision-making, and with my not-for profit experience, a heart for community. I seek re-election on my record of environmental gains, hard work and integrity.
candidates.why_stand: There's no place like Kaipātiki. Nowhere in Auckland can you experience ancient urban forest and such rich biodiversity within 10 minutes from the city. I have felt rewarded representing you but there's more work to do. I want Kaipātiki to be an even better place to live, work and play.

candidates.name: Adrian Tyler
candidates.why_elect: I do not engage in 'in-fighting', I can and do work unilaterally, I have a good understanding of social and environmental issues and I have developed a good understanding of the current problems and systems of Auckland Council over my first term on the Kaipatiki Local Board.
candidates.why_stand: I am running to campaign for and promote local democracy. The Shore Action vision is to empower local people to get things done in their own patch whether it is ecological restoration, placemaking or community house services. Local action and decision making is the most responsive and cost effective approach.

candidates.name: Frances Waaka
candidates.why_elect: I have been active in my community for over 30 years and have grown my children and now my children's children here. I want a more inclusive Kaipatiki for all families living here. I am currently the lead in building our local marae in Beach haven.
candidates.why_stand: I am honest, direct, loyal and hardworking and have a lot of aroha for my whānau and my community. I have been a leader in Kaipātiki for many years working in local sports clubs, religious groups, kapa haka, and schools.

candidates.name: John Gillon
candidates.why_elect: I have been a member of the Kaipatiki Local Board for 3 terms, most recently as Chairperson. I'm a School Board Trustee and admin of three Facebook community groups, connecting 30,000+ members of the local community. I am also past chair of the Glenfield Community Board and Bayview Community Centre.
candidates.why_stand: I love the Kaipātiki area and am devoted to our community and the North Shore way of life. I was born and raised on the Shore and live locally with my young family.

candidates.name: Paula Gillon
candidates.why_elect: I was born in Glenfield, raised in Birkenhead, attended Northcote College and live in Beach Haven—Kaipatiki through and through! I have extensive experience in representing my community in local government and I have an MPhil in Public Policy in local government and active recreation.
candidates.why_stand: Kaipatiki is an amazing place to live and I want to help make it even better! As your representative I want to continue to fight asset sales, improve our bush tracks, expand our pest-free initiatives, build a toddler-friendly playground, progress a beautiful coastal walkway and help to alleviate congestion.

candidates.name: Danielle Grant
candidates.why_elect: We have many significant projects that require leadership and good governance. I am accountable to you. My greatest strength is connecting people and projects, to ensure strong community outcomes. I bring my leadership, team focus, business acumen, open and transparent decision making to the board table.
candidates.why_stand: To build a safe, vibrant and resilient community where we can raise our families, and all feel connected. To enjoy our lifestyle, our beautiful outdoors and to support our sports clubs. To have a variety of efficient public transport options and to maintain and improve our natural environment.

candidates.name: Ann Hartley
candidates.why_elect: I have loved the chance I have had to server our community to do date. I am very proud of what we have achieved for the community.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for re-election to continue my service to our community. I see great potential for Kaipatiki and feel privileged to be standing with Kaipatiki voice, a diverse group of motivated and intelligent people who will contribute greatly to Kaipatiki's future.

candidates.name: Louis Hartley
candidates.why_elect: I have grown up here—I know this community well. My generation is increasingly aware of how the problems facing us today will impact future generations. I will do my best to take action to address the problems facing Kaipātiki. Kaipātiki local board needs a vision, not a placeholder.
candidates.why_stand: I am running for Kaipātiki local board because youth involvement in politics is plummeting. I want to bring a voice to Kaipātiki that represents tomorrow. I feel comfortable running with Kaipātiki Voice because it's a diverse and capable team who represent all of Kaipātiki.

candidates.name: Jesse Jensen
candidates.why_elect: I have a background in fundraising and activism. I have spent the past 3 years actively lobbying the council to provide more public spaces for artists in Auckland. I will be a staunch advocate for minorities and marginalized groups in our community.
candidates.why_stand: I was born here, I am 33. I am from Beach Haven and grew up hard. I am now a self-employed artist and believe my unique life experiences will help me to negotiate with council to achieve better outcomes for our community. Real Values, Real Solutions.
